files.patch:
@@ -2182,4 +2182,3 @@
-    // the normal stub provides a 2nd entry which omits the frame push
-    // for use when bailing out from a disjoint copy
-    // We need to protect memory accesses in certain cases
-    // only some conjoint stubs generate a 2nd entry
+    // The normal stub provides a 2nd entry which omits the frame push
+    // for use when bailing out from a disjoint copy.
+    // Only some conjoint stubs generate a 2nd entry
@@ -2452,1 +2451,1 @@
-    // record the stub entry and end plus any no_push entry
+    // record the stub entry and end
@@ -2739,1 +2738,1 @@
-    // record the stub entry and end plus any no_push entry
+    // record the stub entry and end

@@ -1739,9 +1739,0 @@
-// setter for stub entry addresses inserts them using the stub entry
-// id as an index
-
-#define SET_ENTRY_ADDRESS(type, addr, entry_id)           \
-  {                                                       \
-    int idx = static_cast<int>(entry);                    \
-    _stub_addr[idx] = (address) (addr);                   \
-  }
-
@@ -1974,1 +1965,2 @@
-  log_debug(aot, codecache, init)("External addresses recorded");
+  log_debug(aot, codecache, init)("Recorded %d additional external addresses",
+                                  addresses.length());
@@ -1997,1 +1989,1 @@
-  _c2_stubs_complete = true;
+  _c1_stubs_complete = true;

@@ -27,0 +27,1 @@
+#include "code/aotCodeCache.hpp"
@@ -157,1 +158,2 @@
-
+  // disallow any further c1 stub generation
+  AOTCodeCache::set_c2_stubs_complete();

@@ -177,0 +177,5 @@
+
+#if INCLUDE_CDS
+  // disallow any further generation of runtime stubs
+  AOTCodeCache::set_shared_stubs_complete();
+#endif // INCLUDE_CDS
